page.title: 19EARLS BARTON- AGRICULTURE
page.content: Around the village of Earls Barton,the land is cultivated or used for stock.A small amount of market gardening is carried out with food stuff available direct.Lettuce,tomatoes and potatoes remain cash crops. Farming on the broader scale consists of the production of beef,some sheep rearing and considerable proportions of arable land used for the growing of grain.The other crop in evidence in its season is Oil seed Rape. Of the cereals harvested,wheat predominates, though until recent years barley has been more in evidence. Most of the cereal harvest is used by local mills;outlets for market garden produce exist at Wellingborough, Kettering and Northampton markets as well as to normal retail outlets.
